section.p: The audio module is enabled by default. If you have disabled it using , you can call this method to re-enable it.

The audio module is enabled by default. If you have called to disable the audio module, you can call this method to re-enable it.
The audio module is enabled by default. If you have disabled it using , you can call this method to re-enable it.

ul.li:
Calling this method resets the entire engine and has a relatively slow response time. You can use the following methods to control specific audio module features as needed:
: Whether to enable microphone capture and create a local audio stream.
: Whether to publish the local audio stream.
: Whether to receive and play the remote audio stream.
: Whether to receive and play all remote audio streams.
When calling this method in a channel, it resets the settings of , , and , so use with caution.

: Whether to receive and play all remote audio streams.
When called in a channel, this method resets the settings of , , and . Use with caution.

section.title: Timing
section.p: Can be called before or after joining a channel. Remains effective after leaving the channel.
Can be called before or after joining a channel. Remains effective after leaving the channel.

Can be called before or after joining a channel. Still effective after leaving the channel.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
